comment.author: 85140343@N08
comment._content: Power line on the horizon.  If this is Greene County, Georgia, the poles and wires belong to the members of Rayle EMC (Electric Membership Cooperative).  The Frankliln D. Roosevelt Administration initiated a lot of new government agencies to rescue the country from the Great Depression.  Among those programs was the Rural Electrification Administration which was empowered to provide or guarantee low intererst loans to Electric Membership Cooperatives.  No 'for profit' electric utility would take the loss of building the grid where only one or two subscribers were available per mile of line.  The EMCs saved the day and electrified all of that part of America that would still be in the dark today without the foresight of one of our greatest presidents.
